results.title: Australian diary. No. 036
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The sculling skill of the Towns family are featured in this newsreel. Sydney holds an export packaging display, while apiarists move their bees to new blossoms. A memorial in Canberra honours the deeds of US Forces.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 035
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: The rapid growth of the city of Mackay, on the coast of Queensland; a farm which, as well as ducks, breeds stud geese; a model of a building made from marble by a Gundagai man; Australian sailing-boats and the Sydney to Hobart race as the highlight of the season.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan

results.title: Australian diary. No. 034
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: The items featured in this cinemagazine show the harvesting of apples in Tasmania; the manufacture of costume jewellery; the expoert of South Australian crayfish by air to the United States which is earning valuable export dollars; the work of Matron Shaw at the Crown-Street Women’s Hospital; and the parks and gardens of Canberra.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan

results.brief_description: canberra dog fanciers parade pets at dog show; modern mechanical methods lighten the work of timber getters; a camera analysis of the style of golfer Peter Thompson.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 032
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: A craftsman’s models of the ships and seacraft used in the South-west Pacific area provides a record of the war at sea; novel races at a North Queensland school sports; hop picking in Tasmania; the commencement of the Snowy River Hydro-electric Scheme.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 031
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: A dream come true. This entire newsreel deals with the visit to Australia by Mrs. Evelyn Mortensen of Hollywood. Her trip as winner of the “Queen for a day” competition took in such sights as San Francisco, Hawaii, Fiji, Sydney, Brisbane, the Great barrier Reef, Hobart, Adelaide and Melbourne.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan

results.brief_description: This cinemagazine features: The pearl shell harvest at Broome; the development of a school of industrial design at East Sydney Technical College; the manufacture of paper in Tasmania; the Sydney Glider Club.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 028
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: cadet ship-builders at Whyalla; Tasmania’s historic bridges are put under the spotlight; the tanning and leather industry in Sydney is shown and European migrants give a concert at Canberra.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 027
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: The marvel of mechanisation at a Melbourne Match Factory is featured in this newsreel. Hagley Area School near Launceston providing primary and trade education for country children is visited by the camera. Scientists go to Antarctica to study weather while an Australian relief crew with 12 months supplies sails to Heard Island to take over from the homecoming crew.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan

results.title: Australian diary. No. 026
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: a play centre/nursery school opens in Canberra; Norris E. Dodd, United Nations Director of Food, outlines the world food position; overseas telecommunications are featured and a closer look at Broken Hill is shown.
